@graph.name: How to book a prepaid taxi at Varanasi airport

step.text: Find the Prepaid Taxi counter inside arrivals hall, left of the exit.
Tell the officer your hotel or ghat.
Pay the fixed fare (cash, UPI or card; carry backup cash).
Collect the printed receipt—this is your contract.
Walk to Bays 5–8, show the slip to the coordinator and board your taxi.

mainEntity.name: Is there a night surcharge for prepaid taxis?

acceptedAnswer.text: No. The fare printed on your prepaid slip is final and all‑inclusive.

mainEntity.name: Can I pay with UPI or card?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, most days. Cash always works; keep some in case digital payment terminals are offline.

mainEntity.name: Which app is better, Uber or Ola?

acceptedAnswer.text: Either can be cheaper; check both on arrival because surge and driver supply vary.

mainEntity.name: How far is VNS airport from the ghats?

acceptedAnswer.text: Roughly 25 km (22–25 km), taking 45–90 minutes depending on traffic.

mainEntity.name: What if I leave something in the cab?

acceptedAnswer.text: For prepaid taxis call the airport police with your receipt number; for app‑cabs use the in‑app lost‑item option.
